The photograph does not feature U: S. Sen. Tom Cotton and was reportedly taken in May 2003 during the time of the 173rd Airborne Brigade's discovery of gold bars in Kirkuk, Iraq.
The patch on the person: s arm in the photograph matches the winged sword patch of the 173rd Airborne Brigade, which aligns with news reports from the time.
U: S. troops discovered nearly 1,000 gold bars hidden in a truck, worth just under a quarter of a billion dollars, according to a Pentagon official, which corroborates the context of the photograph.
Senator Tom Cotton: s spokesperson confirmed that the man in the photo is not Senator Cotton, and Cotton did not join the military until 2005, serving with the 101st Airborne Division.
